Dim lineannotation As PdfLineAnnotation = New PdfLineAnnotation(points, "Line Annoation") linkannotation.EndLineStyle = PdfLineEndingStyle.Diamond 'Add this annotation to a new page. page.Annotations.Add(linkannotation) 'Save the document to disk. document.Save("LineEndingStyle.pdf")

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfBookletCreator
member.summary: Represents a booklet creator, which allows to create a booklet from a Pdf document.

example.code: 'Load a PDF document Dim ldoc As PdfLoadedDocument = New PdfLoadedDocument("SourceDoc.pdf") ' Creates a booklet from the given PDF document Dim doc As PdfDocument = PdfBookletCreator.CreateBooklet(ldoc, New SizeF(300, 500)) 'Save the document doc.Save("Booklet.pdf")

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfBookletCreator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfBookletCreator.CreateBooklet(Syncfusion.Pdf.Parsing.PdfLoadedDocument,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.returns: The initialized PDF document, which could be saved.

example.code: 'Load a PDF document Dim ldoc As PdfLoadedDocument = New PdfLoadedDocument("SourceDoc.pdf") 'Creates a booklet from the given PDF document Dim doc As PdfDocument = PdfBookletCreator.CreateBooklet(ldoc, New SizeF(300, 500)) 'Save the document doc.Save("Booklet.pdf")

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfBookletCreator.CreateBooklet(Syncfusion.Pdf.Parsing.PdfLoadedDocument,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true if the result in document should be printed on both sides of paper.
member.returns: The initialized PDF document, which could be saved.

example.code: 'Load a PDF document Dim ldoc As PdfLoadedDocument = New PdfLoadedDocument("SourceDoc.pdf") 'Creates a booklet from the given PDF document Dim doc As PdfDocument = PdfBookletCreator.CreateBooklet(ldoc, New SizeF(300, 500), False) 'Save the document doc.Save("Booklet.pdf")

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfBookletCreator.CreateBooklet(Syncfusion.Pdf.Parsing.PdfLoadedDocument,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Boolean,Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfMargins)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true if the result in document should be printed on both sides of paper.
The margin value for generated PDF document.
member.returns: The initialized PDF document, which could be saved.

example.code: ' Loads an existing document Dim srcDoc As PdfLoadedDocument = New PdfLoadedDocument("sourceDoc.pdf") ' Specify the margin. Dim margin As PdfMargins = New PdfMargins() margin.All = 10 'Creates a booklet from the given PDF document Dim doc As PdfDocument = PdfBookletCreator.CreateBooklet(srcDoc,New SizeF(300, 500), False,margin) doc.Save("Booklet.pdf")

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfBookletCreator.GetNextPair(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the next pair of page indeces.
member.param: if set to true if the result in document should be printed on both sides of paper.
member.returns: An array of integers that holds the indices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfCatalog.ViewerPreferences
member.summary: Gets or sets the viewer preferences.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.PageMode = PdfPageMode.UseAttachments doc.ViewerPreferences.PageScaling = PageScalingMode.None doc.ViewerPreferences.FitWindow = True doc.ViewerPreferences.PageLayout = PdfPageLayout.SinglePage ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfCatalog.Form
member.summary: Gets or sets the interactive form.

example.code: 'Create a new PDf document Dim document As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = document.Pages.Add() ' Creates a form Dim form As PdfForm = document.Form Dim font As PdfFont = New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Courier, 12f) 'Create list box Dim listBox As PdfListBoxField = New PdfListBoxField(page, "list1") 'Add the field to listbox. form.Fields.Add(listBox) 'Set the properties. listBox.Bounds = New RectangleF(100, 350, 100, 50) listBox.HighlightMode = PdfHighlightMode.Outline 'Add the items to the list box listBox.Items.Add(New PdfListFieldItem("English", "English")) listBox.Items.Add(New PdfListFieldItem("French", "French")) listBox.Items.Add(New PdfListFieldItem("German", "German")) 'Select the item listBox.SelectedIndex = 2 'Set the multiselect option listBox.MultiSelect = True document.Save("Form.pdf")

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.Merge(Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase,Syncfusion.Pdf.Parsing.PdfLoadedDocument)
member.summary: Merges the specified dest.

example.code: ' Source document. Dim srcDoc As PdfLoadedDocument = New PdfLoadedDocument("Src1.pdf") ' Destination PDF document Dim destDoc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Merge the source pdf document. PdfDocumentBase.Merge(destDoc, srcDoc) destDoc.Save("Merge.pdf")

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.DisposeOnClose(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Adds an object to a collection of the objects that will be disposed during document closing.
member.param: The object that will be disposed during document closing.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create Pdf graphics for the page Dim g As PdfGraphics = page.Graphics ' Loads an Image Dim img As Image = Image.FromFile("Logo.png") Dim pdfImg As PdfImage = New PdfBitmap(img) 'Draw the image g.DrawImage(pdfImg,20, 20, 100,200) doc.Save("DisposeOnClose.pdf") ' Dispose the Img object along with the document. doc.DisposeOnClose(img)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.SaveAsync(Windows.Storage.StorageFile)
member.summary: Saves the Pdf document to a storage file
member.param: Storage file to save the PDF document.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.Close
member.summary: Closes the document. Releases all common resources.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create Pdf graphics for the page Dim g As PdfGraphics = page.Graphics ' Loads an Image Dim pdfImg As PdfImage = New PdfBitmap(Image.FromFile("Logo.png")) 'Draw the image g.DrawImage(pdfImg,20, 20, 100,200) 'Save the document doc.Save("Close.pdf") ' Closes the document doc.Close()

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the document.
member.param: if set to true the document should close its stream as well.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create Pdf graphics for the page Dim g As PdfGraphics = page.Graphics ' Loads an Image Dim pdfImg As PdfImage = New PdfBitmap(Image.FromFile("Logo.png")) 'Draw the image g.DrawImage(pdfImg,20, 20, 100,200) 'Save the document doc.Save("Close.pdf") ' Closes the document completely. doc.Close(True)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.Save(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the document to the specified stream.
member.param: The stream object where PDF document will be saved.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create Pdf graphics for the page Dim g As PdfGraphics = page.Graphics ' Loads an Image Dim pdfImg As PdfImage = New PdfBitmap(Image.FromFile("Logo.png")) 'Draw the image g.DrawImage(pdfImg, 20, 20, 100, 200) ' Save the document as a stream Dim stream As MemoryStream = New MemoryStream() doc.Save(stream)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.ImportPage(Syncfusion.Pdf.Parsing.PdfLoadedDocument,Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfPageBase)
member.summary: Imports a page.
member.returns: The page in the target document.

example.code: ' Source document Dim srcDoc As PdfLoadedDocument = New PdfLoadedDocument("SrcDocument.pdf") 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() ' Importing pages from source document. doc.ImportPage(srcDoc, srcDoc.Pages(0)) doc.Save("ImportPages.pdf")

example.code: ' Source document Dim srcDoc As PdfLoadedDocument = New PdfLoadedDocument("SrcDocument.pdf") 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() ' Importing pages from source document. doc.ImportPage(srcDoc, 0) doc.Save("ImportPages.pdf")

Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.PageLayout = PdfPageLayout.TwoPageLeft doc.ViewerPreferences.PageScaling = PageScalingMode.AppDefault doc.ViewerPreferences.PageMode = PdfPageMode.FullScreen doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() ' Set the document`s compression level doc.Compression = PdfCompressionLevel.Best 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() doc.Save("Compression.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocumentBase.FileStructure

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s cross reference Type doc.FileStructure.CrossReferenceType = PdfCrossReferenceType.CrossReferenceStream ' set the pdf version doc.FileStructure.Version = PdfVersion.Version1_6 ' Save the document doc.Save("FileStructure.pdf")

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.SaveAsync(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Save the document to a stream in Asynchronous mode.
member.param: Stream for saving the PDF document.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Save(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the document to the specified stream.
member.param: The stream object where PDF document will be saved.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create Pdf graphics for the page Dim g As PdfGraphics = page.Graphics ' Loads an Image Dim pdfImg As PdfImage = New PdfBitmap(Image.FromFile("Logo.png")) 'Draw the image g.DrawImage(pdfImg, 20, 20, 100, 200) ' Save the document as a stream Dim stream As MemoryStream = New MemoryStream() doc.Save(stream)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the document.
member.param: if set to true the document should be disposed completely.
member.remarks: The document is disposed after calling the Close method. So, the document can't be saved if Close method was invoked.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create Pdf graphics for the page Dim g As PdfGraphics = page.Graphics 'Create a solid brush Dim brush As PdfBrush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim fontSize As Single = 20f 'Set the font Dim font As PdfFont = New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, fontSize) 'Draw the text g.DrawString("Hello world!", font, brush,New PointF(20,20)) doc.Save("Sample.pdf") ' Closes the document. doc.Close(True)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
member.value: A new object that is a copy of this instance.
member.remarks: The resulting clone must be of the same type as or a compatible type to the original instance.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create Pdf graphics for the page Dim g As PdfGraphics = page.Graphics 'Create a solid brush Dim brush As PdfBrush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim fontSize As Single = 20f 'Set the font Dim font As PdfFont = New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, fontSize) 'Draw the text g.DrawString("Hello world!", font, brush,New PointF(20,20)) ' Cloning the document Dim cloneDoc As PdfDocument = doc.Clone() cloneDoc.Save("Clone.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.IsPdfViewerDocumentDisable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the document was PDF viewer document.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Pages
member.summary: Gets the collection of the pages in the document.
member.value: A object containing the list of document's pages.
member.remarks: This collection is exposed for usability purposes only. The pages are contained in the sections. So, sections should be used for pages manipulating.

example.code: ' Creates a new document Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() ' Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Page collection Dim pageCollection As PdfDocumentPageCollection = doc.Pages Dim standardFont As PdfFont = New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.TimesRoman,10) ' Drawing string on first page pageCollection(0).Graphics.DrawString("FirstPage", standardFont, PdfBrushes.Black, New PointF(10, 10)) doc.Save("Pages.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.PageSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets page settings of the document's sections.

example.value: A object containing the setting values for a document`s pages.
example.code: ' Create a new document class object. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Set page size doc.PageSettings.Size = PdfPageSize.A6 'Set page orientation doc.PageSettings.Orientation = PdfPageOrientation.Landscape doc.Save("PageSettings.pdf")

member.remarks: The changing of the settings doesn't take any effect on the already existing pages.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Bookmarks
member.summary: Gets the root of the bookmark tree in the document.
member.value: A object specifying the document's bookmarks.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() 'Create outline Dim bookMark As PdfBookmark = document.Bookmarks.Add("InteractiveFeature") bookMark.Color = Color.DarkBlue bookMark.TextStyle = PdfTextStyle.Bold bookMark.Title = "Interactive Feature" bookMark.Destination = New PdfDestination(page) doc.Save("Bookmarks.pdf")

member.remarks: Creates an bookmark root instance if it's called for first time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Form
member.summary: Gets the interactive form of the document.

example.code: ' Create a document. Dim document As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = document.Pages.Add() 'Create a text box Dim firstNameTextBox As PdfTextBoxField = New PdfTextBoxField(page, "firstNameTextBox") firstNameTextBox.Bounds = New RectangleF(100, 20, 200, 20) firstNameTextBox.Font = font 'Add the textbox in form document.Form.Fields.Add(firstNameTextBox) document.Save("Form.pdf")

member.value: The object contains the list of form elements of the document.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the color space of the document.
member.remarks: This property has impact on the new created pages only. If a page was created it remains its colour space obliviously to this property changes.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s color spaces as GrayScale doc.ColorSpace = PdfColorSpace.GrayScale doc.Save("ColorSpace.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Cache

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.PageCount

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.Conformance
member.summary: Gets or Sets the Pdf Conformance level. Supported : PDF/A-1b - Level B compliance in Part 1
member.remarks: Not Supported under Medium Trust environment.

example.code: 'Create a new PDF document. Dim document As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument(PdfConformanceLevel.Pdf_A1B) ' Create a page to the document. Dim page As PdfPage = document.Pages.Add() ' Create a 'Times New Roman' font Dim font As Font = New Font("Times New Roman", 10) ' Create font with bold font style. Dim pdfFont As PdfFont = New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, False) 'Draw text in the new page. page.Graphics.DrawString("Essential PDF", pdfFont, PdfBrushes.Black, New PointF(10, 10)) 'Save document to disk. document.Save("ConformanceLevel.pdf")

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfDocument.ProgressEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate for the event.

example.code: 'Create a new PDF document. Private document As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Add new pages to the document. Private page As PdfPage = document.Pages.Add() 'Create font and font style. Private font As PdfFont = New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 12f, PdfFontStyle.Bold) 'Draw text in the new page. page.Graphics.DrawString("Essential PDF", font, PdfBrushes.Black, New PointF(10, 10)) AddHandler document.SaveProgress, AddressOf document_SaveProgress 'Saves the document document.Save("Document.pdf"); ' Handles the event Private Sub document_SaveProgress(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal arguments As ProgressEventArgs) MessageBox.Show(String.Format("Current: {0}, Progress: {1}, Total {2}", arguments.Current, arguments.Progress, arguments.Total)) End Sub

member.summary: Gets the total number of the elements (pages) that need to be saved.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.ProgressEventArgs.Current
member.summary: Gets the current element (page) index that just was saved.
member.remarks: The index value increases constantly from 0 to Total.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.ProgressEventArgs.Progress
member.summary: Gets the progress.
member.remarks: Progress constantly increases from 0.0 to 1.0. 1.0 value means that entire document has been saved.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfFileStructure
member.summary: This class represents a set of the properties that define the internal structure of PDF file.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s cross reference type doc.FileStructure.CrossReferenceType = PdfCrossReferenceType.CrossReferenceStream ' Set the pdf version doc.FileStructure.Version = PdfVersion.Version1_6 ' Set the pdf version doc.Save("FileStructure.pdf")

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: Defines the way the document is to be presented on the screen or in print.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.PageMode = PdfPageMode.UseAttachments doc.ViewerPreferences.PageScaling = PageScalingMode.None doc.ViewerPreferences.FitWindow = True doc.ViewerPreferences.PageLayout = PdfPageLayout.SinglePage ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes new instance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to position the documents window in the center of the screen.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.CenterWindow = True ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.DisplayTitle
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the windows title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary. If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the Pdf file containing the document.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.DisplayTitle = True ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to resize the documents window to fit the size of the first displayed page.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.FitWindow = True ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideMenubar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications menu bar when the document is active.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.HideMenubar = True ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideToolbar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications tool bars when the document is active.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.HideToolbar = True ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the documents window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the documents contents displayed.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI = True ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.PageMode
member.summary: A name object specifying how the document should be displayed when opened.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.PageMode = PdfPageMode.UseAttachments ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.PageLayout
member.summary: A name object specifying the page layout to be used when the document is opened.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.PageLayout = PdfPageLayout.SinglePage ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.PageScaling
member.summary: Gets or Set the page scaling option to be selected when a print dialog is displayed for this document.

example.code: 'Create a new document. Dim doc As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Create a page Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() ' Set the document`s viewer preference doc.ViewerPreferences.PageScaling = PageScalingMode.None ' Save the document doc.Save("ViewerPreferences.pdf")

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfCrossReferenceType.CrossReferenceTable
member.summary: The cross-reference table contains information that permits random access to indirect objects within the file so that the entire file need not be read to locate any particular object. The structure is useful for incremental updates, since it allows a new cross-reference section to be added to the PDF file, containing entries only for objects that have been added or deleted. Cross-reference is represented by cross-reference table. The cross-reference table is the traditional way of representing reference type.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfCrossReferenceType.CrossReferenceStream
member.summary: Cross-reference is represented by cross-reference stream. Cross-reference streams are stream objects, and contain a dictionary and a data stream. This leads to more compact representation of the file data especially along with the compression enabled. This format is supported by PDF 1.5 version and higher only.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfConformanceLevel.None
member.summary: Specifies Default / No Conformance.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfConformanceLevel.Pdf_A1B
member.summary: This PDF/A ISO standard [ISO 19005-1:2005] is based on Adobe PDF version 1.4 and This Level B conformance indicates minimal compliance to ensure that the rendered visual appearance of a conforming file is preservable over the long term.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfConformanceLevel.Pdf_X1A2001
member.summary: This PDF/X-1a:2001 ISO standard [ISO 15930-1] is based on Adobe PDF version 1.3 which uses only CMYK + Spot Color and this compliance to ensure that the contents will be reliably reproduced in the repress environment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfListField.SelectedValue

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags
member.summary: Represents fields flags enum.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Default
member.summary: Default field flag.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, the user may not change the value of the field. Any associated widget annotations will not interact with the user; that is, they will not respond to mouse clicks or change their appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is useful for fields whose values are computed or imported from a database.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field can contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the fields text is restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard should instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheck
member.summary: If set, text entered in the field is not spell-checked.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.DoNotScroll
member.summary: If set, the field does not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than fits within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text is accepted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Comb
member.summary: Meaningful only if the MaxLen entry is present in the text field dictionary and if the Multiline, Password, and FileSelect flags are clear. If set, the field is automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen, and the text is laid out into those combs.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.RichText
member.summary: If set, the value of this field should be represented as a rich text string. If the field has a value, the RVentry of the field dictionary specifies the rich text string.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
member.summary: If set, exactly one radio button must be selected at all times; clicking the currently selected button has no effect. If clear, clicking the selected button reselects it, leaving no button selected.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a check box. This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag is clear.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.PushButton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.RadiosInUnison
member.summary: If set, a group of radio buttons within a radio button field that use the same value for the on state will turn on and off in unison; that is if one is checked, they are all checked. If clear, the buttons are mutually exclusive.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Edit
member.summary: If set, the combo box includes an editable text box as well as a drop-down list; if clear, it includes only a drop-down list. This flag is meaningful only if the Combo flag is set.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the fields option items should be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by form authoring tools, not by PDF viewer applications.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: If set, more than one of the fields option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, no more than one item at a time may be selected.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.FieldFlags.CommitOnSelChange
member.summary: If set, the new value is committed as soon as a selection is made with the pointing device. This option enables applications to perform an action once a selection is made, without requiring the user to exit the field. If clear, the new value is not committed until the user exits the field.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfBorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the available styles for a field border.

example.code: 'Create a new PDf document Dim document As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() ' Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = document.Pages.Add() 'Create submit button Dim submitButton As PdfButtonField = New PdfButtonField(page, "submitButton") submitButton.Bounds = New RectangleF(100, 500, 90, 20) submitButton.Font = font submitButton.Text = "Submit" ' Set the border style for the button field submitButton.BorderStyle = PdfBorderStyle.Dashed document.Form.Fields.Add(submitButton) document.Save("Form.pdf")

member.remarks: Defaule value is Solid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfBorderStyle.Solid
member.summary: A solid rectangle surrounding the annotation.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfBorderStyle.Dashed
member.summary: A dashed rectangle surrounding the annotation.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfBorderStyle.Beveled
member.summary: A simulated embossed rectangle that appears to be raised above the surface of the page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfBorderStyle.Inset
member.summary: A simulated engraved rectangle that appears to be recessed below the surface of the page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfBorderStyle.Underline
member.summary: A single line along the bottom of the annotation rectangle.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfHighlightMode
member.summary: Specifies the highlight mode for a field.

example.code: ' Create a new PDf document Dim document As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = document.Pages.Add() 'Create the signature field Dim sign As PdfSignatureField = New PdfSignatureField(page, "sign1") sign.Bounds = New RectangleF(100, 420, 100, 50) ' Set the high light mode for a signature field sign.HighlightMode = PdfHighlightMode.Push document.Form.Fields.Add(sign) document.Save("Form.pdf")

member.remarks: Defaule value is Invert.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfHighlightMode.NoHighlighting
member.summary: No highlighting.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfHighlightMode.Invert
member.summary: Invert the contents of the field rectangle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfHighlightMode.Outline
member.summary: Invert the field's border.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfHighlightMode.Push
member.summary: Pushed highlighting.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfCheckBoxStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style for a check box field.
member.remarks: The default value is Check.

example.code: 'Create a new PDf document Dim document As PdfDocument = New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = document.Pages.Add() 'Create a check box Dim checkBox As PdfCheckBoxField = New PdfCheckBoxField(page, "C#.NET") checkBox.Bounds = New RectangleF(100, 290, 20, 20) ' Add the check box field in form`s field collection document.Form.Fields.Add(checkBox) checkBox.HighlightMode = PdfHighlightMode.Push checkBox.BorderStyle = PdfBorderStyle.Beveled ' Set the check style checkBox.Style = PdfCheckBoxStyle.Star checkBox.Checked = True document.Save("Form.pdf")

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfCheckBoxStyle.Check
member.summary: A check mark is used for the checked state.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfCheckBoxStyle.Circle
member.summary: A circle is used for the checked state.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfCheckBoxStyle.Cross
member.summary: A cross is used for the checked state.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfCheckBoxStyle.Diamond
member.summary: A diamond symbol is used for the checked state.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfCheckBoxStyle.Square
member.summary: A square is used for the checked state.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfCheckBoxStyle.Star
member.summary: A star is used for the checked state.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfDestinationMode.Location
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the top-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A NULL value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a NULL value.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Interactive.PdfDestinationMode.FitToPage
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfCancelEventArgs
member.summary: Represents the data for a cancelable event.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") End Sub 'Begin Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub BeginPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As BeginPageLayoutEventArgs) e.Cancel=True End Sub

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfCancelEventArgs.m_cancel
member.summary: Indicates whether lay outing should be stopped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfCancelEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is cancel.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim rect As New RectangleF(0, 0, page.GetClientSize().Width, 50) Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") End Sub 'Begin Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub BeginPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As BeginPageLayoutEventArgs) e.Cancel=True End Sub

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.BeginPageLayoutEventArgs
member.summary: Data for event before lay outing of the page.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim m_paginateStart As Bool= True Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'Begin Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub BeginPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As BeginPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim bounds As RectangleF = e.Bounds ' First column. If (Not m_paginateStart) Then bounds.X = bounds.Width + 20f bounds.Y = 10f End If e.Bounds = bounds End Sub

Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'Begin Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub BeginPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As BeginPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim bounds As RectangleF = e.Bounds ' First column. If (Not m_paginateStart) Then bounds.X = bounds.Width + 20f bounds.Y = 10f End If e.Bounds = bounds End Sub

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.BeginPageLayoutEventArgs.Page
member.summary: Gets the page where the lay outing should start.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim m_paginateStart As Bool= True Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'Begin Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub BeginPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As BeginPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim page As PdfPage = e.Page End Sub

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.EndPageLayoutEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about layout`s element .

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim m_paginateStart As Bool= True Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'End Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub EndPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As EndPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim args As EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs = CType(e, EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim tlr As PdfTextLayoutResult = args.Result Dim bounds As RectangleF = tlr.Bounds args.NextPage = tlr.Page End Sub

Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'End Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub EndPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As EndPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim args As EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs = CType(e, EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim tlr As PdfTextLayoutResult = args.Result Dim bounds As RectangleF = tlr.Bounds args.NextPage = tlr.Page End Sub

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.EndPageLayoutEventArgs.NextPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the next page where the element should be layout if the process is not finished or stopped.
member.remarks: The default value is null. In this case the element will be layout on the next page.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim m_paginateStart As Bool= True Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'End Page Layout Event Handler. Private Sub EndPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As EndPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim tlr As PdfTextLayoutResult = args.Result args.NextPage = tlr.Page End Sub

member.summary: Gets a result of the lay outing on the page.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim m_paginateStart As Bool= True Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'End Text Page Layout Event Private Sub EndPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As EndPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim args As EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs = CType(e, EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim tlr As PdfTextLayoutResult = args.Result Dim bounds As RectangleF = tlr.Bounds End Sub

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.BeginPageLayoutEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate. Defines a type of the event before lay outing on the page.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim m_paginateStart As Bool= True Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'End Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub EndPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As EndPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim args As EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs = CType(e, EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim tlr As PdfTextLayoutResult = args.Result Dim bounds As RectangleF = tlr.Bounds args.NextPage = tlr.Page End Sub

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.EndTextPageLayoutEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate. Defines a type of the event after the text lay outing on the page.

example.code: 'Create a PDF document Dim doc As New PdfDocument() 'Creates a new page and adds it as the last page of the document Dim page As PdfPage = doc.Pages.Add() Dim m_paginateStart As Bool= True Dim brush As New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim pen As New PdfPen(Color.Black, 1f) 'Creates a new pdf font Dim pdfFont As New PdfStandardFont(PdfFontFamily.Helvetica, 11.5f) Dim font As New Font("Calibri", 14f, FontStyle.Bold) Dim trueTypeFont As New PdfTrueTypeFont(font, True) Dim path As string = "..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\..\Common\Data\PDF\Essential studio.txt" Dim reader As New StreamReader(path, Encoding.ASCII) Dim text As string = reader.ReadToEnd() reader.Close() Dim column As New RectangleF(0, 20, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Width / 2f - 10f, page.Graphics.ClientSize.Height) 'Create text element Dim element As New PdfTextElement(text, pdfFont) element.Brush = New PdfSolidBrush(Color.Black) Dim layoutFormat As New PdfLayoutFormat() layoutFormat.Break = PdfLayoutBreakType.FitPage layoutFormat.Layout = PdfLayoutType.Paginate 'Raise the event when the text flows to next page. element.BeginPageLayout += New BeginPageLayoutEventHandler(BeginPageLayout2) 'Get the remaining text that flows beyond the boundary. Dim result As PdfTextLayoutResult = element.Draw(page, column, layoutFormat) 'Saves the document. doc.Save("Sample.pdf") 'End Text Page Layout Event Handler Private Sub EndPageLayout2(ByVal sender As object, ByVal e As EndPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim args As EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs = CType(e, EndTextPageLayoutEventArgs) Dim tlr As PdfTextLayoutResult = args.Result Dim bounds As RectangleF = tlr.Bounds args.NextPage = tlr.Page End Sub

member.summary: Clones the object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.LineAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical text alignment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates text direction mode.
member.remarks: Note, that this property doesn't change any alignment of the text. property should be set manually to align the text. This property just enables or disables support of right to left approach. If the value is False, the text won't be checked for right to left symbols occurrence.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets value that indicates a size among the characters in the text. When the glyph for each character in the string is rendered, this value is added to the the glyphs displacement.
member.remarks: Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.WordSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets value that indicates a size among the words in the text. Word spacing works the same way as character spacing but applies only to the space character, code 32.
member.remarks: Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.LineSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets value that indicates the vertical distance between the baselines of adjacent lines of text.
member.remarks: Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.ClipPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text should be a part of the clipping path.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.SubSuperScript
member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating whether the text is in subscript or superscript mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.ParagraphIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the first line in the paragraph.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.LineLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [line limit].

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.MeasureTrailingSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [measure trailing spaces].
member.value: true if [measure trailing spaces]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.NoClip
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [no clip].

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating type of the text wrapping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.HorizontalScalingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor.
member.remarks: The default scaling factor is 100, which means 100% and original size. It's used to make PDF font looking smaller when metafile is rendered into PDF.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfStringFormat.FirstLineIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent of the first line in the text.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontEncoding.IdentityH
member.summary: The horizontal identity mapping for 2-byte CIDs; may be used with CIDFonts using any Registry, Ordering, and Supplement values. It maps 2-byte character codes ranging from 0 to 65,535 to the same 2-byte CID value, interpreted high-order byte first.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags
member.summary: Enumerator that implements font descriptor flags.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags.FixedPitch
member.summary: All glyphs have the same width (as opposed to proportional or variable-pitch fonts, which have different widths).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags.Serif
member.summary: Glyphs have serifs, which are short strokes drawn at an angle on the top and bottom of glyph stems (as opposed to sans serif fonts, which do not).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags.Symbolic
member.summary: Font contains glyphs outside the Adobe standard Latin character set. The flag and the nonsymbolic flag cannot both be set or both be clear.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags.Script
member.summary: Glyphs resemble cursive handwriting.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags.Nonsymbolic
member.summary: Font uses the Adobe standard Latin character set or a subset of it.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags.Italic
member.summary: Glyphs have dominant vertical strokes that are slanted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.FontDescriptorFlags.ForceBold
member.summary: Bold font.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfMetrics.MacStyle
member.summary: Regular: 0 Bold: 1 Italic: 2 Bold Italic: 3 Bit 0- bold (if set to 1) Bit 1- italic (if set to 1) Bits 2-15- reserved (set to 0). NOTE: Note that macStyle bits must agree with the 'OS/2' table fsSelection bits. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Microsoft Windows. The PANOSE values and 'post' table values are ignored for determining bold or italic fonts.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.MacStyle
member.summary: Regular: 0 Bold: 1 Italic: 2 Bold Italic: 3 Bit 0 - bold (if set to 1) Bit 1 - italic (if set to 1) Bits 2-15 - reserved (set to 0) NOTE: Note that macStyle bits must agree with the 'OS/2' table fsSelection bits. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Microsoft Windows. The PANOSE values and 'post' table values are ignored for determining bold or italic fonts.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.Flags
member.summary: Bit 0 - baseline for font at y=0 Bit 1 - left SideBearing at x=0 Bit 2 - instructions may depend on point size Bit 3 - force ppem to integer values for all private scaler math; may use fractional ppem sizes if this bit is clear Bit 4 - instructions may alter advance width (the advance widths might not scale linearly) Note: All other bits must be zero.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.LowestRecPPEM
member.summary: LowestRecPPEM: Smallest readable size in pixels.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.FontDirectionHint
member.summary: FontDirectionHint: 0 Fully mixed directional glyphs 1 Only strongly left to right 2 Like 1 but also contains neutrals -1 Only strongly right to left -2 Like -1 but also contains neutrals.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.IndexToLocFormat
member.summary: 0 for short offsets, 1 for long.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHeadTable.GlyphDataFormat

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable
member.summary: This table contains information for horizontal layout. The values in the minRightSidebearing, minLeftSideBearing, and xMaxExtent should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purpose of these calculations. All reserved areas must be set to 0.

member.summary: Version.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfHorizontalHeaderTable.LineGap

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table
member.summary: The OS/2 table consists of a set of metrics that are required by Windows and OS/2.

member.summary: Struct field.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.XAvgCharWidth
member.summary: The Average Character Width parameter specifies the arithmetic average of the escapement (width) of all of the 26 lowercase letters a through z of the Latin alphabet and the space character. If any of the 26 lowercase letters are not present, this parameter should equal the weighted average of all glyphs in the font. For non-UGL (platform 3, encoding 0) fonts, use the unweighted average.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWeightClass
member.summary: Indicates the visual weight (degree of blackness or thickness of strokes) of the characters in the font.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWidthClass
member.summary: Indicates a relative change from the normal aspect ratio (width to height ratio) as specified by a font designer for the glyphs in a font.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.FsType
member.summary: Indicates font embedding licensing rights for the font. Embeddable fonts may be stored in a document. When a document with embedded fonts is opened on a system that does not have the font installed (the remote system), the embedded font may be loaded for temporary (and in some cases, permanent) use on that system by an embedding-aware application. Embedding licensing rights are granted by the vendor of the font.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSubscriptXSize
member.summary: The recommended horizontal size in font design units for subscripts for this font.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.YSubscriptYSize
member.summary: The recommended vertical size in font design units for subscripts for this font.

member.summary: The recommended horizontal offset in font design units for subscripts for this font.

member.summary: The recommended vertical offset in font design units from the baseline for subscripts for this font.

member.summary: This parameter is a classification of font-family design.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.Panose
member.summary: This 10 byte series of numbers are used to describe the visual characteristics of a given typeface. These characteristics are then used to associate the font with other fonts of similar appearance having different names. The variables for each digit are listed below. The specifications for each variable can be obtained in the specification PANOSE v2.0 Numerical Evaluation from Microsoft or Elseware Corporation.

member.summary: The four character identifier for the vendor of the given type face.

member.summary: Information concerning the nature of the font patterns.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsFirstCharIndex
member.summary: The minimum Unicode index (character code) in this font, according to the cmap subtable for platform ID 3 and encoding ID 0 or 1. For most fonts supporting Win-ANSI or other character sets, this value would be 0x0020.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsLastCharIndex
member.summary: usLastCharIndex: The maximum Unicode index (character code) in this font, according to the cmap subtable for platform ID 3 and encoding ID 0 or 1. This value depends on which character sets the font supports.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.STypoAscender
member.summary: The typographic ascender for this font. Remember that this is not the same as the Ascender value in the 'hhea' table, which Apple defines in a far different manner. DEF_TABLE_OFFSET good source for usTypoAscender is the Ascender value from an AFM file.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.STypoDescender
member.summary: The typographic descender for this font. Remember that this is not the same as the Descender value in the 'hhea' table, which Apple defines in a far different manner. DEF_TABLE_OFFSET good source for usTypoDescender is the Descender value from an AFM file.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.STypoLineGap
member.summary: The typographic line gap for this font. Remember that this is not the same as the LineGap value in the 'hhea' table, which Apple defines in a far different manner.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWinAscent
member.summary: The ascender metric for Windows. This too is distinct from Apple's Ascender value and from the usTypoAscender values. usWinAscent is computed as the yMax for all characters in the Windows ANSI character set. usTypoAscent is used to compute the Windows font height and default line spacing. For platform 3 encoding 0 fonts, it is the same as yMax.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UsWinDescent
member.summary: The descender metric for Windows. This too is distinct from Apple's Descender value and from the usTypoDescender values. usWinDescent is computed as the -yMin for all characters in the Windows ANSI character set. usTypoAscent is used to compute the Windows font height and default line spacing. For platform 3 encoding 0 fonts, it is the same as -yMin.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UlCodePageRange1
member.summary: This field is used to specify the code pages encompassed by the font file in the 'cmap' subtable for platform 3, encoding ID 1 (Microsoft platform). If the font file is encoding ID 0, then the Symbol Character Set bit should be set. If the bit is set (1) then the code page is considered functional. If the bit is clear (0) then the code page is not considered functional. Each of the bits is treated as an independent flag and the bits can be set in any combination. The determination of "functional" is left up to the font designer, although character set selection should attempt to be functional by code pages if at all possible.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.Fonts.TtfOS2Table.UlCodePageRange2
member.summary: This field is used to specify the code pages encompassed by the font file in the 'cmap' subtable for platform 3, encoding ID 1 (Microsoft platform). If the font file is encoding ID 0, then the Symbol Character Set bit should be set. If the bit is set (1) then the code page is considered functional. If the bit is clear (0) then the code page is not considered functional. Each of the bits is treated as an independent flag and the bits can be set in any combination. The determination of "functional" is left up to the font designer, although character set selection should attempt to be functional by code pages if at all possible.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfTransformationMatrix.Shear(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies the specified shear vector to this Matrix by prepending the shear transformation.
member.remarks: The transformation applied in this method is a pure shear only if one of the parameters is 0. Applied to a rectangle at the origin, when the shearY factor is 0, the transformation moves the bottom edge horizontally by shearX times the height of the rectangle. When the shearX factor is 0, it moves the right edge vertically by shearY times the width of the rectangle. Caution is in order when both parameters are nonzero, because the results are hard to predict. For example, if both factors are 1, the transformation is singular (hence noninvertible), squeezing the entire plane to a single line.

member.summary: Applies a clockwise rotation about the specified point.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineJoin
member.summary: Specifies the corner style of the shapes.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: The outer edges for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineJoin.Round
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges for the two segments.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: The two segments are finished with caps and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineCap
member.summary: Specifies the line cap style to be used at the ends of the lines.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineCap.Flat
member.summary: The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineCap.Round
member.summary: A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfLineCap.Square
member.summary: The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is squared off.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.ColorIntent
member.summary: Describes the Color intents.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.ColorIntent.AbsoluteColorimetric
F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.ColorIntent.RelativeColorimetric
member.summary: Colors are represented with respect to the combination of the light source and the output mediums white point (such as the color of unprinted paper).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.ColorIntent.Saturation
member.summary: Colors are represented in a manner that preserves or emphasizes saturation.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.ColorIntent.Perceptual
member.summary: Colors are represented in a manner that provides a pleasing perceptual appearance.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode
member.summary: Specifies the blend mode for transparency.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values. The result color is always at least as dark as either of the two constituent colors. Multiplying any color with black produces black; multiplying with white leaves the original color unchanged. Painting successive overlapping objects with a color other than black or white produces progressively darker colors.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result. The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors. Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged. The effect is similar to projecting multiple photographic slides simultaneously onto a single screen.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Graphics.PdfBlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.summary: The current background color should be used to fill the rectangle.

member.summary: The text will be clipped to the rectangle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.ETO.GLYPH_INDEX
member.summary:
Windows 95 and Windows NT 4.0 and later: The lpString array refers to an array returned from GetCharacterPlacement and should be parsed directly by GDI as no further language-specific processing is required. Glyph indexing only applies to TrueType fonts, but the flag can be used for bitmap and vector fonts to indicate that no further language processing is necessary and GDI should process the string directly.
Note that all glyph indexes are 16-bit values even though the string is assumed to be an array of 8-bit values for raster fonts.
For ExtTextOutW, the glyph indexes are saved to a metafile. However, to display the correct characters the metafile must be played back using the same font. For ExtTextOutA, the glyph indexes are not saved.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.ETO.NUMERICSLATIN
member.summary: Windows 95 and Windows NT 4.0 and later: To display numbers, use European digits.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.ETO.NUMERICSLOCAL
member.summary: Windows 95 and Windows NT 4.0 and later: To display numbers, use digits appropriate to the locale.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.ETO.RTLREADING
member.summary: Windows 95 and Windows NT 4.0 and later for Middle East language edition of Windows: If this value is specified and a Hebrew or Arabic font is selected into the device context, the string is output using right-to-left reading order. If this value is not specified, the string is output in left-to-right order. The same effect can be achieved by setting the TA_RTLREADING value in SetTextAlign. This value is preserved for backward compatibility.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.ETO.IGNORELANGUAGE
member.summary: Windows NT 4.0 and later: Reserved for system use. If an application sets this flag, it loses international scripting support and in some cases it may display no text at all.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.ETO.PDY
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: When this is set, the array pointed to by lpDx contains pairs of values. The first value of each pair is, as usual, the distance between origins of adjacent character cells, but the second value is the displacement along the vertical direction of the font.

member.summary: Constants from WinGdi.h file.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.SRCCOPY
member.summary: Copies the source rectangle directly to the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.SRCPAINT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.SRCAND
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.SRCINVERT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.SRCERASE
member.summary: Combines the inverted colors of the destination rectangle with the colors of the source rectangle by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.NOTSRCCOPY
member.summary: Copies the inverted source rectangle to the destination.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.NOTSRCERASE
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean OR operator and then inverts the resultant color.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.MERGECOPY
member.summary: Merges the colors of the source rectangle with the specified pattern by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.MERGEPAINT
member.summary: Merges the colors of the inverted source rectangle with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.PATCOPY
member.summary: Copies the specified pattern into the destination bitmap.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.PATPAINT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the pattern with the colors of the inverted source rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator. The result of this operation is combined with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean OR operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.PATINVERT
member.summary: Combines the colors of the specified pattern with the colors of the destination rectangle by using the Boolean XOR operator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.DSTINVERT
member.summary: Inverts the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.BLACKNESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 0 in the physical palette. This color is black for the default physical palette.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.WHITENESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index 1 in the physical palette. This color is white for the default physical palette.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Pdf.Native.RASTER_CODE.SRCANDDST
member.summary: Combines the colors of the source and destination rectangles by using the Boolean AND operator.

member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension in which the specified transition effect occurs.

member.summary: Gets or sets the the direction of motion for the specified transition effect.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfPageTransition.Direction
member.summary: The direction in which the specified transition effect moves, expressed in degrees counter clockwise starting from a left-to-right direction. (This differs from the page objects Rotate property, which is measured clockwise from the top.)

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfPageTransition.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting or ending scale at which the changes are drawn. If Motion property specifies an inward transition, the scale of the changes drawn progresses from Scale to 1.0 over the course of the transition. If Motion specifies an outward transition, the scale of the changes drawn progresses from 1.0 to Scale over the course of the transition.
member.remarks: This property has effect for Fly transition style only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Pdf.PdfPageTransition.PageDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets The pages display duration (also called its advance timing): the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page is displayed during presentations before the viewer application automatically advances to the next page. By default, the viewer does not advance automatically.
